The transformation from segregated work settings can bring liberation and empowerment. But the process of change is not always easy or comfortable for individuals with I/DD and their families. A variety of issues can come up for people with I/DD as the agencies that serve them switch to integrated employment:

  1. Cessation of weekly paychecks when their workshop shuts down.
  2. They might stop seeing their friends on a daily basis once the workshop closes.
  3. They may get a part-time job, leaving the rest of the day needing to be filled.
  4. Their family may feel the pressure of helping their relative find and keep fulfilling work in the community.

So how do we get to where people have a satisfying job and relationships in the community? Join us for a candid discussion of this. Register here.
